books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: Maiwa’s Revenge
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A famed hunter aids a tribe in their plot for revenge.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: Uneasy Money
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Lord Dawlish unexpectedly comes into an inheritance, he travels from London to New York to try to give it away.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Ben Jonson
books.summary: A rollicking Elizabethan comedy in which two con men and their female compatriot gull a series of unfortunate victims out of their money.

books.title: The Princess and the Goblin
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A princess and her young friend valiantly fend off a goblin attack with help from a ghostly relative.

books.title: The Rasp
books.author: Philip MacDonald
books.summary: A retired colonel investigates the elaborate murder of a cabinet minister.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Uncle Silas
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: An heiress becomes ward to her disreputable uncle with an unsavory past, tainted by the apparent suicide of a man to whom he owed a large gambling debt, and must help clear his name.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Kural
books.author: Thiruvalluvar
books.summary: An Indian weaver-philosopher expounds on the subjects of righteousness, wealth, and love.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
books.summary: A collection of poems by Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Gladiator
books.author: Philip Wylie
books.summary: A young man, given superhuman abilities by his scientist father, tries to find purpose and use for his powers.

books.title: American Indian Stories
books.author: Zitkála-Šá
books.summary: A collection of stories about Dakota Indians.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
